parse: Verb - Perfect Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural

str2: The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Fitting season, season, opportunity, occasion, time. Of uncertain affinity; an occasion, i.e. Set or proper time.
Already; now at length, now after all this waiting. Apparently from e and de; even now.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
(a) I wake, arouse, (b) I raise up. Probably akin to the base of agora; to waken, i.e. Rouse.
From out, out from among, from, suggesting from the interior outwards. A primary preposition denoting origin, from, out.
Sleep; fig: spiritual sleep. From an obsolete primary; sleep, i.e. spiritual torpor.
For. A primary particle; properly, assigning a reason.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Plural
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
Feminine of a derivative of soter as noun; rescue or safety.
Nearer. Neuter of the comparative of eggus; nearer.
A primary particle of present time; 'now'; also as noun or adjective present or immediate.
Or, than. A primary particle of distinction between two connected terms; disjunctive, or; comparative, than.
When, at which time. From hos and te; at which too, i.e. When.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 1st Person Plural
str2: From pistis; to have faith, i.e. Credit; by implication, to entrust.
